intro: During the tutorial: please do not click the App buttons/dialogs. Doing so will change the App conditions to settings other than default tutorial settings and the explanation boxes may not display properly. If the explanation boxes start to display in the top left corner: simply restart the tutorial (and avoid clicking on app components next time!)
First select the type of data to analyze
Specify whether ATAC/ChIP data is Bed or Bedgraph format
Browse for each file (size limit 500mb). If a data type has been selected above, a file must be chosen before the program will proceed
Or you can use sample data instead
If your data contains header insert a check mark in the box, otherwise keep it empty
Choose the appropriate delimiter for your data file
Choose the appropriate quote style for your data file
Once all your data files are chosen, click Process Data to process the data for visualization. This will take some time, so please be patient

A preview of your data will be displayed here and should appear as a well formatted table (see github documentation for an example). If you selected the wrong separator or quote for your data file - the data will not be formatted in a table. If this happens - select the correct separator and click Process Data again
You can choose to view the head or tail of your data file at any time
Proceed to visualize your data by clicking on the Plots tab or the Go to Plots button
All visualization is completed in the Plots tab.
Select the number of samples (up to a maximum of 9 samples) in your HiC data file. This will uniquely color each sample.
Choose Coordinates to manually define the genomic region or choose Genes to search by gene names
Appropriately name your samples in agreement with your dataset. See github documentation for an example
To generate plots centered around a gene of interest, use the default plot settings
Type and choose the appropriate gene. The gene's chromosome and coordinates are shown next to the gene name
Specify the genomic interval you wish to visualize to the left and right of the gene. This defines the window size for the plots
Click the Submit Parameters button to generate the plots
The plots will take time to be generated - please be patient
The HiC bezier curve plot will display in this panel - note that this plot is static
The Genomic network for the HiC data will display in this panel - note that this plot is interactive. Clicking a node in this network will highlight connected nodes
You may generate plots for a different gene or genomic window by changing the parameters and clicking Submit Parameters again
This concludes the tutorial. To view source code and documentation visit our github
